text.title: part3_Antje Duvekot on life as a folk singer, her family and her music

hi.s: DS : Do you feel home up in Boston ?

text.p:
AD :
I do , and part of that is the great folk community .

hi.s:
DS : Why do you think
Boston has
such a well-developed folk scene ?

text.p:
AD :
It ’s always historically been a folk hub .
There ’s a lot of awesome folk stations like
WUMB
and
WERS
.
Legendary folk clubs , like
Club Passim
.
Those have stayed in tact since the
sixties
.

hi.s: DS : Is there anything culturally about Boston that makes it more conducive to folk ?

text.p:
AD :
Once you have a buzz , the buzz creates more buzz .
Some people hear there ’s a folk scene in Boston , and then other people move there , so the scene feeds itself and becomes a successful scene .
It ’s on-going .

hi.s: DS : Do you have a favorite curse word ?
You are the first woman I have met who likes that word !

text.p:
AD :
Oh , really ? I ’ll use it in a traffic situation .
Road rage
. [
Laughs
]

hi.s: DS : Do you find yourself more inspired by man-made creations , including people and ideas , or nature-made creations ?

text.p:
AD :
I love nature , but it is limited .
It is what it is , and does n’t include the human imagination that can go so much further than nature .

hi.s: DS : What are some man made things that inspire you ?

text.p:
AD :
New York City as a whole is just an amazing city .
People are so creative and it is the hub of personal creativity , just in the way people express themselves on a daily basis .

hi.s: DS : Do you think you will return ?

p.s: In theory I will return one day if I have money , but in theory you need money to enjoy yourself .

hi.s: What trait do you deplore in yourself ?

text.p:
AD :
Like anyone , I think
laziness
.
I ’m a bit a hard on myself , but there ’s always more I can do .
As a touring singer-songwriter I work hard , but sometimes I forget because I get to sleep in and my job is not conventional , and sometimes I think ‘ Oh , I do n’t even have a job , how lazy I am ! ’ [
Laughs
]
Then , of course , there are times I ’m touring my ass off and I work hard as well .
It comes in shifts .
There are times there is so much free time I have to structure my own days , and that ’s a challenge .

hi.s: DS : When is the last time you achieved a goal and were disappointed by it and thought , “ Is that all there is ? ” Something you wanted to obtain , you obtained it , and it was n’t nearly as fulfilling as you thought it would be .

text.p:
AD :
I was just thinking about the whole dream of becoming a musician .
I want to maybe do a research project about people ’s dreams and how they feel about them after they come true .
It ’s really interesting .
They change a lot .
When I was 17 I saw
Ani Difranco
on stage and I wanted to do
that
, and now I ’m doing it .
Now I think about Ani very differently .
I wonder how long it took her to drive here , she must be tired ; I ’m thinking of all the pragmatic things that go on behind the scenes .
The backside of a dream you never consider when you ’re dreaming it .
To some extent , having my dream fulfilled has n’t been a let-down , but it ’s changed .
It ’s more realistic .
